constituent: tolerant, house, flowers, look, see, telescope, eye, human legs
heisigStory: The house of flowers or "hothouse" has become a metaphor for a narrow-minded, biased, and intolerant attitude distrustful of change. Tolerance, in contrast, is open-minded and welcomes novelty. The way to encourage tolerance in those who lack it is first to have them see through their own hothouse attitudes, which is the very counsel we are given in this kanji.
koohiiStory1: A tolerant person will ignore SEEing GRASS (marijuana) in the HOUSE of a friend.
koohiiStory2: To be tolerant is to see flowers (meaning "beautiful things") in every house, instead of looking for drawbacks.
kunYomi: くつろ.ぐ、ひろ.い、ゆる.やか
